intro: Tithymalus rhabdotospermus, commonly known as the slender tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. The plant is native to certain regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, similar to other members of the carrot family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
